content: What do you call a person whose age is the sum of the numbers on a standard dice plus 72?

The sum of the numbers on a standard six-sided die (1 to 6) is 21. If you add 72 to this sum, you get 93. Therefore, a person whose age is the sum of the numbers on a standard die plus 72 would be 93 years old. You could simply call them a nonagenarian, as the term refers to someone who is between 90 and 99 years old.
